summary: Paul Merson and Andros Townsend have been involved in a war of words. Merson questioned Townsend's inclusion in the England squad. But Townsend proved his critic wrong by scoring against Italy. Merson admitted he was wrong but had another dig at Townsend on Twitter.

Chelsea have made a formal offer for FC Tokyo forward Yoshinori Muto. The 22-year-old Japan international has scored 16 goals in 37 appearances. Muto would join Chelsea's partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season. He admits it is an 'honour' to receive an offer from the Premier League club.

A large-scale study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be overweight as toddlers.
Researchers suggest that antibiotics may contribute to the obesity epidemic by killing off gut bugs that would normally feed on food, thus freeing up more food for the body and potentially increasing appetite.
The study compared the weight and height of over 12,000 healthy two-year-olds with records on antibiotic prescriptions.
By two years old, one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese, and those who had taken antibiotics as young babies were particularly likely to be overweight.
Repeated prescriptions before age two also raised the odds of being a fat toddler, with boys seeming more prone to weight gain after being given antibiotics.
The study did not prove that antibiotics cause weight gain, but it highlights the importance of judicious antibiotic use in infancy.

The Queen's Guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard. The incident was caught on camera by a tourist at Buckingham Palace. The guard fell to the floor and dropped his rifle in front of hundreds of people.

A&E networks are remaking the epic miniseries "Roots," to air in 2016.
The original miniseries had over 100 million viewers in 1977.
LeVar Burton, who starred in the original, will co-executive produce the new version.
The remake will be simulcast on A&E, Lifetime, and History.

Christopher Lawler claims he was pinned to a chair and groped in 1978. The incident happened on his first day working at Clarence House. Mr Lawler, now 64, said the ordeal left him in tears and he quit on the spot. He contacted palace officials again last year after inquiries into alleged cover-ups of child sex abuse by a VIP paedophile ring in the 1970s and 80s.

Oregon couple Jesse and Melissa Meek announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air' theme song.
The clip, featuring the couple rapping in a car, has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube.
In the video, they reveal their struggle with conceiving and the excitement of finally becoming parents.
They made the video to share the news with loved ones living far away.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in Gone With The Wind sold for $137,000 at auction on Saturday. The jacket and full skirt ensemble was one of more than 150 items from the 1939 film sold by Heritage Auctions. Other top sellers included a hat worn by Leigh for $52,500 and Clark Gable's suit for $55,000. The items were part of the private collection of James Tumblin, formerly in charge of hair and makeup at Universal Studios.

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge.
The toddler's mother was holding him and another child when he slipped and fell between 10 to 12 feet into the pit.
He was rescued by his parents before firefighters and paramedics arrived and suffered from minor bumps and bruises.
The boy's leg was injured in the fall, but he was not attacked by the cheetahs.
Cleveland Metroparks Zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A speed camera in Handsworth, Birmingham, has been turned to face a house. The camera has not been operational for over two years. Old technology cameras were turned off across the West Midlands in 2013. Birmingham City Council is aware of the issue and will take action.

A summary of the key points from the passage:

1. **Usain Bolt's Participation**: Usain Bolt will compete in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team.

2. **Event Details**: The relay championship will take place over two days.

Neymar and Dani Alves watched Barcelona's basketball team on Thursday. The pair were joined by Neymar's sister Rafaella for the Euro League match. Barcelona beat Real Madrid 85-80 in the El Clasico basketball contest. Neymar led Brazil to a 1-0 win over Chile in a friendly at the Emirates.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Italy is facing a surge in migrants from Africa and the Middle East attempting to reach Europe. Over a four-day period, 8,480 migrants were rescued, with 20 boats in distress on Monday alone. Save the Children fears 400 migrants may be missing after a ship reportedly capsized in the Mediterranean Sea, but the Italian coast guard has not confirmed this and has found no evidence of such an incident. The number of migrants arriving in Italy has exceeded 10,000 in the first three months of 2015, with many originating from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit country. At least 480 migrants have died in the Mediterranean since the start of the year due to dangerous weather, overcrowded vessels, and abandonment by crew members.

Arsene Wenger delighted Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over Liverpool. The Chile forward joined the Gunners in a £32million deal last summer. Wenger admits Liverpool could have used interest in Sanchez during negotiations over Luis Suarez. The Arsenal boss has played down speculation linking them with Raheem Sterling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break the cycling hour record on June 7. The 35-year-old will ride at London's Olympic Velodrome. Wiggins will hope to beat Australian Rohan Dennis' record of 52.491km. Tickets for the event go on sale on April 19.

Serena Williams beat Sara Errani 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3 in the Fed Cup. But the American was not impressed with her own performance. Williams said the match was an 'eye-opener' ahead of the claycourt season. The US were beaten 3-2 by Italy and relegated to World Group II.

River Plate want to sign Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao. The Colombian spent eight years with the Argentine side before leaving in 2009. River Plate vice president Matias Patanian admits a deal is complicated. Falcao has scored just four Premier League goals on loan at Old Trafford.

Ella Henderson, 19, is the face of Batiste's 'Ready For It' campaign. The X Factor finalist is showcasing various hairstyles in the ads. This is the first brand collaboration for the platinum award-winning artist.

Aaron Siler, 26, was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres on March 14. Torres is currently on leave pending the outcome of the investigation. A billboard paid for by the Kenosha Professional Police Association featuring Torres and his dog has been erected. Siler's family and friends have called the billboard 'disrespectful' The police association claims no offence was intended and that the billboard was simply to thank the community for its support.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- **Incident**: Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the border with Pakistan. Three militants were also killed.
- **Location**: The fighting occurred in the southeastern Iranian town of Negur.
- **Perpetrators**: The militant group Jaish al Adal, an anti-Iranian Sunni Muslim group based in Balochistan, Pakistan, claimed responsibility.
- **Response**: Iranian officials requested Pakistani authorities to capture the surviving assailants. Pakistan condemned the attack and promised to investigate and take action if the militants entered Pakistan.
- **Background**: Jaish al Adal has previously targeted Shiites and aimed to counter Iranian influence in Pakistan, with a notable attack in October 2013 killing 14 Iranian border guards.
- **Tensions**: Iran has criticized Pakistan for not effectively controlling terrorist activities along their shared border.

A lawmaker in Japan asked the country's Defense Minister if fighter jets had ever been scrambled to meet UFOs. Gen Nakatani said the Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) had never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object. The exchange isn't the first time Japanese politicians have discussed the implications of visitors from another planet.

Jin Pai, 35, was standing on the rim of a toilet in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport because he was 'worried it might not be clean'. The toilet shattered, leaving him with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks. He was found bleeding on the floor and taken to hospital where he received several dozen stitches.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

* **Who:** Kevin Rebbie, 56, from Limerick Township, Pennsylvania

* **What:** Arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a 15-year-old girl for four years and filming her and others with a hidden camera in a bathroom.

* **How:** The girl found the camera under the sink in March 2023.

* **Charges:** Aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy.

* **Evidence:** 41 videos found on Rebbie's computer, 34 showing victims showering, some with close-ups of genitalia.

* **Rebbie's Confession:** Admitted to filming multiple victims, including other juveniles, specifically targeting the 15-year-old girl.

* **Current Status:** Held on $500,000 bail, preliminary hearing set for May 1st.

A series of images by Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama see fathers leaping into the air next to their daughters. The images are part of a book which roughly translates as 'Daughter and Salaryman'. Each picture sees the daughter looking directly into the camera smiling while her father pulls a dramatic pose. The photographer's website states the images allow the father to express his fun side by being 'a hero jumping the sky'. Very little else is known about the pictures but they are already drumming up plenty of interest online.

Kevin Pietersen was in reflective mood as Surrey posed for team photo. Batmen looked deep in thought during shoot at KIA Oval. Pietersen was axed by England in 2014 but could make a sensational return to the international set-up. Paul Downton was sacked as England's managing director on Wednesday. Surrey begin their County Championship campaign at Glamorgan on April 19.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Romanian club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt has dismissed Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week due to poor performance.

Radamel Falcao has struggled to score goals for Manchester United.
The Colombian joined on a season-long loan from Monaco last summer.
Falcao's former team-mate Nabil Dirar believes he should have stayed at Monaco.

Summary:

- New Zealand police are seeking public assistance to identify a tall male robber who wore a 'distinctive' cartoon mask during a dairy heist in Christchurch.

- The offender, captured on security footage wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt and an oversized mask, stole the dairy's till and approximately $1,500 in cash.

- The incident occurred on Saturday when the masked man demanded cash from the dairy owner's daughter, prompting her to flee the shop screaming 'robber!'.

- The robber remains at large, and police have not found any evidence of weapons used during the crime.

- Anyone with information is encouraged to contact Crimestoppers or message the police online.

Kaitlyn Granado, 24, was arrested on Monday for allegedly having sex with a 15-year-old pupil on two consecutive nights in January. The math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, was first arrested last month for letting another 15-year-old boy touch her breasts. Granado was released on bail after her second arrest and it is not known how she intends to plead.

A video of a crocodile with a dead dog in its mouth has gone viral. The croc was swimming in a public marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico. New Zealander Tim Weston was on holiday when he saw the attack. He said the dog belonged to the local bike shop's owner. Crocodiles are a common sight in the tourist hotspot as it is built among mangroves where they have lived for centuries. The video has been viewed more than 500,000 times online.

Steve Bruce is confident Hull City can avoid Premier League relegation. Hull were beaten 2-0 by Southampton and are two points clear of the drop zone. Bruce targeting 10 wins at start of season but has managed just six. Hull have six games left including fixtures against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham and Manchester United.

Ian Guffick, 31, asked pupils to change answers after exam session finished. He also altered answers himself before papers were sent off. Department for Education annulled whole school's SATs results for 2014. Guffick banned from teaching for at least two years.

Anders Lindegaard has been struggling for game time at Manchester United. The Danish goalkeeper is third choice at Old Trafford behind David de Gea and Victor Valdes. Lindegaard married Swedish model Misse Beqiri last year. The couple have a son together and have been dating since 2012.

Reggie Jackson put the 13 letters up for auction at Sotheby's on Wednesday but there were no bids. The letters were expected to bring in $300,000 to $600,000. A Sotheby's employee raised a paddle for $260,000 but it was only to jump start the bidding. Jackson bought the letters after the stadium's final game in 2008. The Yankee Hall of Famer said he wanted 'a new generation to own and enjoy this icon' The letters were installed in 1976 and beamed over the Bronx for more than 30 years.

Brendan Rodgers has reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe of their professional responsibilities. The Liverpool pair were pictured with shisha pipes. But Rodgers has decided against disciplining the duo. Steven Gerrard is available for Sunday's FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa.

Mesut Ozil posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog on Wednesday. The Arsenal playmaker has returned to London following international duty. Ozil helped Germany to a 2-0 win over Georgia in Euro 2016 qualifier. The 26-year-old is now focusing on Premier League clash with Liverpool.

Josep Maria Bartomeu says Barcelona are 'very happy' with Luis Enrique. Speculation had suggested Enrique could be replaced in the summer. But Bartomeu insists the La Liga leaders have no plans to replace him. Enrique only took charge at the club last summer on a two-year deal.

Jordan Henderson has agreed a new long-term contract with Liverpool. The 24-year-old is set to pen a deal worth £100,000-a-week until 2020. Henderson could replace Steven Gerrard as club captain next season. He is the third key player to agree an extension after Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Filipe Luis, the Chelsea left back, wants to stay at the club until his contract expires, despite Atletico Madrid's interest in re-signing him.
- Luis signed a three-year deal when he joined Chelsea from Atletico in 2014 but has faced competition for his position.
- He expressed happiness at Chelsea and stated his desire to see out his contract.
- After recent international friendlies with Brazil, Luis is now focusing on the Premier League title run-in.

Nathan Hughes had his three-week ban for knocking out George North overturned on appeal. The Wasps No 8 was initially suspended for being 'reckless' when his knee collided with North's head as he scored a try for Northampton. But an appeal lodged by Wasps was upheld and the red card was rescinded. North was left unconscious and has been advised to take a month off.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- **Cause of Sunsets**: The intense reddish sunsets in Washington and surrounding areas were caused by wildfires in southeastern Siberia.
- **How It Happened**: Farmers' grass-burning in fields led to out-of-control flames due to strong winds, destroying dozens of villages.
- **Smoke Travel**: Smoke from the fires was carried by atmospheric winds across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, affecting parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia.
- **Scientific Explanation**: Smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors (greens, blues, yellows, purples) from sunlight, allowing longer wavelengths like reds and oranges to penetrate the air unfiltered, especially during sunrises and sunsets due to increased atmospheric travel.
- **Resolution**: As the smoke dissipates, the air quality will improve, and the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig's 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway in St. Louis, Missouri on Monday night. It was found on April 1 with new red rims and detailing, as well as orange accents on the steering wheel. Schoenig was grateful for the 'upgrade' and posted a photo on Facebook thanking the thieves. However, she is now getting the car professionally cleaned due to a strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana. She is also creating a smoothie at her restaurant, The Hot Pot, to honor the man who located her car.

Manchester City players have incentivised contracts to ensure the club stays within financial fairplay rules.
The Premier League champions could miss out on £12m in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League.
Manuel Pellegrini's side are currently fourth but face a battle to finish in the top four after losing to Manchester United.

Manchester United's Under 18s beat Manchester City 1-0 in the 'mini-derby'. Callum Gribbin scored the only goal with a delightful free-kick. The match was played at Altrincham's Moss Lane with close to 1,000 in attendance. United lined up with a formation similar to the club's first team. The result leaves United two points behind leaders Middlesbrough.

Joe Hart labelled Gianluigi Buffon a 'legend of the game' after Italy's 1-1 draw with England on Tuesday night.
Hart reached the milestone of 50 international caps in the match.
The Manchester City goalkeeper said Buffon was an inspiration.

Chipotle is teaming up with Postmates to offer delivery in 67 cities. The restaurant will add a 9% service charge to delivery orders. Postmates uses independent contractors who drive their own cars. Other fast food chains are also expanding delivery services.

The parents of Martin Richard, the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombings, write an opinion piece in The Boston Globe. They urge the Justice Department to take the death penalty off the table for convicted bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev. The Richards say they want to end the anguish and move toward a better future for their family, Boston, and the country. They argue that pursuing the death penalty could bring years of appeals and prolong the pain of reliving the bombings. Instead, they support a life sentence without the possibility of release for Tsarnaev.

The custom-built Boeing 747, which cost £400million, was designed for a mystery billionaire over three years. It includes bedrooms, multiple lounges, a restaurant, and can accommodate dozens of guests. The plane, which normally carries 600 passengers, has been transformed into a luxurious flying home.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket with a Dragon cargo spacecraft from Cape Canaveral, Florida, bound for the International Space Station (ISS).
- The primary mission was successful, with Dragon en route to the ISS carrying over 4,300 pounds of supplies, including an espresso maker.
- SpaceX attempted to land the rocket's first stage on a floating barge but was unsuccessful; the rocket landed but tipped over.
- The company aims to reduce space travel costs by reusing rockets, with Elon Musk claiming a potential hundredfold reduction in expenses.
- This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the ISS, and the launch was delayed from Monday due to weather conditions.

Priscilla Presley, 69, will witness the first wedding at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas on April 23. The contest, in collaboration with NBC's Today show, will see an Elvis-obsessed couple win a free wedding, hotel suite, airfares, and concert tickets. The Westgate Hotel, formerly the Las Vegas Hilton, is where Elvis performed over 830 sold-out shows. Priscilla has been involved in designing the chapel, which is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit outside his Memphis home. Couples must submit a video or photos explaining why they deserve the prize.

Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool can catch Manchester City. Henderson played his 47th game of the season in win over Newcastle. Raheem Sterling and Joe Allen scored in 2-0 win at Anfield. City lost 4-2 at Manchester United and are four points ahead of Liverpool.

Roma beat Napoli 1-0 in Serie A on Saturday. Miralem Pjanic scored the only goal of the game in the 25th minute. Morgan de Sanctis made several saves to secure the win. Roma end four-month winless streak at home; Napoli winless in five.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Their match against Fleetwood Town ended in a dull 0-0 draw, lacking exciting moments.

A man named Roland Giroux uploaded a video showcasing his unique bond with his blood parrot cichlid. Giroux gently strokes and massages the fish in its tank, demonstrating an unusual level of interaction between human and marine pet. The fish appears to enjoy the attention, relaxing in Giroux's hand and swimming back to him for more. Giroux explains that he hand-feeds the fish and has noticed its increasing sociability. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid species first bred in Taiwan in the 1980s.

Ben Stokes has a fiery character but must learn to control his aggression.
Stokes has been recalled to the England team for the third Test against West Indies in Barbados.
England coach Peter Moores had a positive influence on Stokes after his clash with Marlon Samuels.
Stokes can bring runs and wickets to the England team with his aggression.
Wales host Belgium in a crucial Euro 2016 qualifier on June 12. The match at Cardiff City Stadium has sold out with 33,000 tickets gone. Wales are top of Group B with Belgium on goal difference.

John Peacock has named his England Under-17 squad for the European Championship in Bulgaria. The Young Lions are the defending champions, having beaten Holland in last year's final. They will face Holland, Italy and the Republic of Ireland in Group D. The squad includes players from Chelsea, Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester United.

Here's a concise summary of the passage:

- Manchester City are interested in signing 14-year-old Anderlecht playmaker, Evangelos Patoulidis.
- Patoulidis is considered a top talent and has also been pursued by Arsenal and Barcelona.

- Manchester City has initiated talks with Anderlecht's chairman, Roger Vanden Stock, to negotiate a compensation package for the player.
- City's manager, Manuel Pellegrini, aims to strengthen the team's future by acquiring Patoulidis.

The body of Vanessa Santillan, 33, was found in Fulham, London, in March. A 23-year-old man has been arrested in connection with her death. Miss Santillan, a Mexican national, worked as a transgender escort. Scotland Yard is appealing for anyone who knew her to come forward.

Dawn, who has suffered seven miscarriages, had saved £207 towards a £500 gravestone for her son Daniel James.
She accused housemate Jamie, a convicted burglar, of stealing the money and he was found to be lying by a lie detector test on the Jeremy Kyle show.
Dawn burst into tears and stormed off the stage when the results were revealed.

ISIS releases more than 200 Yazidis, most of them women and children. Arab tribal leaders helped coordinate the release, a commander says. The Yazidis are a religious minority in northern Iraq that has been persecuted by ISIS.

Harry Kane is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season awards. The Tottenham striker features in a new animation showing some of his best goals and celebrations from the season. The video was produced by Copa90 using still photographs to create an animated effect. Kane is up against Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez for the top prize.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers is still the right man to manage Liverpool despite a season without a trophy.
Rodgers' future has been questioned after a third straight season without silverware.
Carragher says the players that came in haven't 'bedded in yet'
Liverpool are seven points behind fourth-placed Manchester City with a game in hand.

James Hayward had packed his bright coloured toy in hand luggage. But security officers at East Midlands Airport took exception to the toy. They demanded he hand it over and patted him down. Dad Phil has labelled the security checks 'ludicrous' Airport has since apologised but said they followed government guidelines.

A 31-year-old man from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an ad on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife.
The ad outlines his 'requirements' for a partner, including that she must love pets, be fit and attractive, and be 'great in bed'.
The man, who calls himself 'Rich', also details his own qualities, such as being 'well endowed', owning property, and making 'great money'.
He offers benefits such as a company car, phone, and laptop, as well as a free gym membership and a phone of her choice.
The ad specifies that 'all reasonable offers will be considered' and that former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke wants to increase minimum number of homegrown players in club squads from eight to 12. Dyke also wants to change the rules so that 'homegrown' means having trained in England for three years before the age of 18. Five former England managers have backed Dyke's proposals in an open letter. Only 81 of the 220 Premier League starters in the last round of matches were eligible for England selection.

Demelza Poldark, played by Eleanor Tomlinson, gives birth to a baby girl. In the previous episode, she had only just announced her pregnancy. Fans have noticed the rapid progression of the pregnancy. This is not the first time the show has had a speedy pregnancy.

A summary of the key points from the passage:

- Leicester City, bottom of the Premier League, are three points from safety after back-to-back wins.
- Manager Nigel Pearson urges his team to focus on their own games and not get distracted by their relegation rivals' results.
- Pearson believes their survival is in their own hands and wants the team to maintain their recent improvement.
- He warns against excessive optimism and emphasizes the importance of staying focused on their own performances.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara has set a new record for the longest migration of a mammal ever recorded. Varvara swam approximately 14,000 miles (22,500 kilometers) from her primary feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island to Baja, Mexico, surpassing the previous record held by a humpback whale. The journey suggests that Varvara might be an eastern gray whale rather than an endangered western gray whale, prompting scientists to re-evaluate the distinction between the two species.

A large mass of land has emerged along the Shiretoko Peninsula near Rausu, on Hokkaido Island, Japan. The land, which measures roughly 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide, rose as high as 50ft from the sea surface in some places. Geologists believe the emergence was caused by a nearby landslide, when melting ice and snow caused a section of land to drop, pivoting the underwater area into the air. Local residents reported feeling no tremors or hearing any sounds overnight and were surprised to find the new stretch of coastline in the morning. Authorities do not expect the landmass to expand further and have confirmed it is not related to the recent earthquake in Nepal.

Gregory van der Wiel has denied claims he will leave Paris Saint-Germain. The defender had a recent falling out with manager Laurent Blanc. But Van der Wiel says he 'loves' the club and wants to sign a new contract. Barcelona's Dani Alves has been linked with a move to the French champions.

Carlos Tevez has told Juventus he wants to leave the club this summer. The 31-year-old striker is keen on a return to former club Boca Juniors. Boca president Daniel Angelici says Tevez must terminate his contract. Tevez still has a year left to run on his current deal with the Serie A champions.

Pep Guardiola's trousers ripped during Bayern Munich's 6-1 win over Porto in the Champions League. The Bayern manager joked he would need to buy new trousers for the next match. Guardiola's side booked their place in the semi-finals with an impressive display at the Allianz Arena.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

A multi-vehicle crash involving ten people, including four children, occurred on the Brisbane Valley Highway near Fernvale. Three vehicles collided, resulting in multiple injuries. Two adults and two children were airlifted to Princess Alexandra Hospital with chest and arm injuries, while six others were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries. The highway was closed, with diversions in place, as emergency crews worked at the scene.

Mesut Ozil showed off his new Apple Watch on Instagram on Thursday. The Arsenal playmaker compared the device to Michael Knight's watch from the hit 1980s show Knight Rider. Ozil is expected to start for the Gunners against Chelsea on Sunday. Arsenal trail the Premier League leaders by 10 points with six games left. Ray Parlour has backed Jack Wilshere to be the future of the club.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby on Sunday. The English official has sent off three players from both United and City this season. Vincent Kompany will miss the game after being sent off for Belgium. Clattenburg is regarded as one of the Premier League's leading referees.

Federal MP Bob Katter has accused the Queensland Government of racism over its handling of Billy Gordon's domestic violence accusations.
Mr Katter said the Government believed Mr Gordon would quit, and described him as 'a little black puppet on a string'.
The statement has sparked criticism online, with users questioning his terminology.
Mr Katter later defended his comments, saying he used the term 'black puppet' due to his own experiences with racism.

Dayna Dobias, 19, from Downers Grove, Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She has made a video of her dancing in a bid to inspire others. The teenager says she is tired of being defined by her disability. She hopes the video will encourage people to think before they judge.

Orlando City are interested in signing Javier Hernandez from Man United. The Mexican has struggled on loan at Real Madrid this season. Hernandez would be a popular signing with Orlando's Latin-American fanbase. But eight European clubs are also interested in the 26-year-old. United have offered a new contract to teenage midfielder Andreas Pereira.

At least three people poured gasoline on a car at a South Los Angeles gas station and set it on fire on Saturday morning. The driver said he got into an argument with the suspects while pumping gas; they then tried to carjack him. The group covered his white Dodge Charger in gasoline and lit it ablaze while there were two passengers inside. No one was injured, but the car's entire front end was torched. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as an arson, and the suspects remain at large.

Charles Manuel, a chiropractor from Lamoni, Iowa, surrendered his license after being accused of accepting sex as payment and performing exorcisms.
He admitted to his misdeeds and agreed not to apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years.
Despite the charges, Manuel has received excellent patient satisfaction ratings on HealthGrades.com.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

A U.S. reconnaissance plane (RC-135U) was intercepted by a Russian fighter jet (SU-27 Flanker) over the Baltic Sea in international airspace. The U.S. crew deemed the Russian pilot's actions "unsafe and unprofessional" due to aggressive maneuvers performed in close proximity. Russia claimed the U.S. plane was flying towards the Russian border with its transponder off, but the U.S. denies this. The U.S. will file an official complaint with Russia through diplomatic channels. Similar incidents between these aircraft models have occurred in the past, with the U.S. complaining about close passes in the western Pacific a year ago.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot days before President Obama visited Utah.
The gun was locked inside a hard rifle case secured with padlocks and chains in the agent's car.
Thief broke the car window, tied a rope around the case, and used momentum from another vehicle to break the lock.
Other items including gear bags, clothing, and tools were also stolen during the March 27 theft.
The agent's bags were found at a nearby hotel, but the sniper rifle remains unrecovered.
Police do not know if the thief specifically targeted the agent's car.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of murdering his neighbour Terrence Freebody in 2012. He allegedly stomped on his head, cut his throat and stabbed him. A forensic psychiatrist believes Costa was suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the murder. The jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa's unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Wandsworth Council has been the primary contributor to Investing Solutions' profits, paying over £2.1m in the past two years.

The passage discusses the end of an era for Fleet Street, once the heart of British journalism, with the closure of the London office of the Sunday Post and the redundancy of its last two journalists, Gavin Sherriff and Darryl Smith. Fleet Street was synonymous with national newspapers for decades, with nearly every major paper having offices there at its height. The street was known for its bars and pubs, where journalists socialized and sought stories. However, the rise of television and social media, along with new printing technology, led to the decline of Fleet Street's importance. Media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's move to Wapping in 1986 accelerated this decline, with most newspapers following suit by 1988. Today, the buildings that once housed major newspapers have been repurposed, marking the final deadline for this infamous era of British history. While the last journalists are leaving, they reflect on the street's rich history and their own roles in carrying its torch.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

A study by the University of Edinburgh reveals that poverty significantly increases the likelihood of youth violence and contact with the police. Children from deprived backgrounds are twice as likely to face police action for crimes compared to better-off children. The research also finds that:

- Poverty exacerbates the risk of offending, even when other risk factors are considered.
- People in extreme poverty are more likely to be victims and perpetrators of crime.
- Gender is a strong predictor of violence, with boys three times more likely to engage in violent acts than girls.
- Girls from poorer backgrounds are twice as likely to be involved in violent crime compared to affluent girls.
- A history of police trouble strongly predicts lack of education, employment, or training by age 18.
- Poorer youth are five times more likely to be under statutory supervision.

The findings raise concerns about the concentration of crime in deprived areas and question the effectiveness of the Scottish government's inequality reduction efforts, despite overall crime rate decreases.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- **Key Players**: The primary cyber warfare groups in the Ukraine conflict are the Ukrainian Cyber Troops, Cyber Berkut, and Anonymous International. All claim to be independent activists.

- **Cyber Berkut**: An anti-Western group, they target Ukraine's government websites and accuse Kiev of genocide. They claim to have hacked Joe Biden's team and disrupted Ukraine's election systems. Their rhetoric aligns with Russian state media.
- **Anonymous International**: Known for publishing leaked Kremlin documents, they focus on Russia's domestic affairs and have leaked information related to Ukraine, including emails from a former Russian FSB colonel.
- **Tactics**: These groups employ various tactics, including DDoS attacks, hacking official documents, disrupting services, and spreading propaganda through hijacked systems.
- **Impact**: Their actions have influenced information warfare, potentially impacted funding for separatists, and contributed to the overall tension and narrative of the conflict.

Summary:

- **Discovery**: Ancient earthworks, possibly 2,000 years old, were found in the western Brazilian Amazon (Acre state) by a research team including experts from Swansea University, Exeter University, Reading University, and Brazil's SÃ£o Paulo and BelÃ©m universities.

- **Geoglyphs**: Over 450 large geometrical "geoglyphs" were discovered in ditched enclosures, previously hidden by bamboo-dominated rainforest and revealed by modern deforestation.

- **Purpose**: The function of these sites is unclear, but they are unlikely to be villages or defensive structures. They may have been used as ritual gathering places, similar to Maya pyramids or Stonehenge.

- **Environment**: Dr. Neil Loader's analysis of soil samples, phytoliths (microscopic plant fossils), charcoal quantities, and carbon stable isotopes suggests the geoglyphs were built in taller vegetation and were not visible above the forest canopy.

- **Human Influence**: The research challenges the notion of pristine Amazonian forests before European arrival in the 16th century. It indicates a diverse plant ecosystem over 6,000 years, artificially created by humans, with evidence of ancient "agroforestry" practices still influencing modern forest biodiversity.

Clive Weatherhogg, 42, was found guilty of coercing a woman to have sex with another man he found online, and filming it. UK detectives investigating the murders of David Miller and Hannah Witheridge on a Thai beach have finished their work in Thailand. Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Apple is implementing a two-step verification process for iCloud to prevent the theft of celebrity photos and other data. The system requires users to enter a four-digit code sent to a trusted device in addition to their password when accessing iCloud from a new device. This blocks unauthorized access even if a password is stolen or guessed. The change follows suggestions that third-party software was used to exploit iCloud and steal intimate celebrity photos. While the feature is currently optional, security experts recommend making it the default setting for improved security. Apple plans to encourage users to enable two-factor authentication and use stronger passwords.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Women with the BRCA1 gene mutation, like Angelina Jolie, can significantly reduce their risk of dying from breast cancer by having their ovaries removed (oophorectomy).
- A study found that oophorectomy after breast cancer diagnosis lowered the risk of breast cancer death by 62% in BRCA1 carriers.
- The procedure was most effective when performed within two years of diagnosis, resulting in a 73% reduction in death.
- The protective effect of oophorectomy against breast cancer lasts for 15 years.
- BRCA1 and BRCA2 gene mutation carriers have a 50-80% lifetime risk of developing breast cancer.
- Oophorectomy also reduces the risk of ovarian cancer, which is severe in BRCA gene mutation carriers.
- Further research is recommended, especially for BRCA2 carriers and those undergoing oophorectomy as initial treatment.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

The passage describes the plight of Carlos Toro, a 66-year-old former mid-level member of the Medellin cartel who became an undercover informant for the DEA for 27 years. In exchange for his work, he was promised US citizenship but has now been told he will be deported after retiring due to health issues. Toro's work helped in the prosecution of significant figures like Carlos Lehder and Manuel Noriega. Despite his contributions, the DEA has refused to assist him in obtaining citizenship, leaving him in legal limbo and fearing for his life if deported back to Colombia. He remains unpaid and unable to collect social security benefits, relying on support from former colleagues.

Here's a concise summary of the passage:

- The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) is investigating the Canadian company Vox Populi Registry Ltd. for potentially illegal actions related to the new '.sucks' domain name.

- ICANN could take action against Vox Populi if U.S. or Canadian regulators find their actions illegal.

A mother was arrested 27 years after her baby boy's body was found in a pond, wrapped in a blanket inside a Sainsbury's bag.

* The body was exhumed for a case review, and DNA samples led police to the mother.

* The baby, originally buried as an "unknown baby boy," was reburied with the name Peter.

- Hicks was on his way home from a night out in Bath, Somerset, when Young mistakenly thought he was going to "do a runner" and decided to teach him a lesson by driving him back to the taxi rank.
- Hicks objected, and when Young continued driving, Hicks jumped from the vehicle while it was traveling at over 20 mph.
- Hicks' family took Young to the High Court, where a judge ruled that Young had unlawfully imprisoned Hicks and was entitled to damages.
- The compensation amount is yet to be decided but is expected to be around 50% of the family's requested amount, thought to be "hundreds of thousands of pounds."
- Hicks suffered devastating brain injuries, developed epilepsy, and now requires round-the-clock care from his mother.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- A tornado was spotted near Goddard, Kansas, southwest of Wichita, and moved northeast, posing risks to nearby communities.

An 85-year-old pilot, Chris Georgaklis, made an emergency belly landing at an airport in Fort Pierce, Florida, after forgetting to deploy the landing gear. The incident, captured on video, is being investigated by the FAA. Human error is the most common cause of such gear-up landings.

A Sicilian mafia fugitive, Domenico Rancadore, will be allowed to stay in the UK after his sentence was dropped.

Key points:

* Rancadore, known as the "Godfather of Uxbridge," was convicted in Italy in 1999 for being a member of the Cosa Nostra and sentenced to seven years.
* He fled to Britain in the 1990s and lived under the name Marc Skinner for over two decades.
* Italian authorities sought his extradition, but his sentence expired in October 2014 due to Italian law stating a sentence is extinguished after more than double the penalty time has passed.
* Rancadore's conviction still stands, but he will not serve prison time.
* His solicitor expressed confidence that the Italian government will withdraw the arrest warrant, allowing Rancadore to remain in England with his family.

- Virginia Trimble Ritter's daughter, Marcia, was murdered in 1975 by Jerome Sydney Barrett, who raped and choked her to death.
- Marcia's body was found 33 days after her disappearance, and Ritter's husband at the time advised her not to view the body or crime scene photos.
- Recently, after decades of declining to see the photos, Ritter viewed them and described the graphic details of her daughter's condition.
- Barrett was convicted of second-degree murder in 2009 and sentenced to 44 years in prison.
- The case remained unsolved for 33 years, with an incorrect suspect charged in 1979.
- Barrett was linked to the crime through DNA evidence obtained after his arrest for another murder in 2006.

Rory McIlroy aims to complete career Grand Slam by winning the Masters. World No 1 says it is 'unthinkable' he will not win at Augusta National. McIlroy collapsed in the final round in 2011 but bounced back to win US Open. Northern Irishman has one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances.

**Summary:**

- **Hospital Admissions:** 272 children in England were hospitalized in the past 12 months due to disabilities from fetal alcohol syndrome (FAS).
- **Potential Affected Cases:** Experts suggest the actual number affected by maternal drinking could be much higher, possibly around 7,500 annually in the UK (based on WHO research).
- **Long-term Impact:** Children with FAS do not improve over time and may face learning, behavioral, and physical problems.
- **Example:** A 15-year-old girl, Niamh Brown, born with FAS, requires assistance with daily tasks and will never be able to live independently.
- **Medical Issues:** FAS can lead to various medical problems, including issues with liver, kidneys, heart, cerebral palsy, sight loss, and epilepsy.
- **Guidance:** Pregnant women are advised by the government to avoid alcohol. If they choose to drink, it should be limited to up to two units no more than twice a week. Some experts advocate for a stricter guideline of no alcohol during pregnancy.

- An axe-wielding robber, Shaun Andrew McKerry (31), attempted to rob a post office and store in County Durham.
- The owner, Sab Dhillon, rugby tackled him, and his wife, Sam, hit McKerry with a baseball bat to disarm him.
- McKerry, known as "Boomerang Boy" for always returning home after crimes, has a history of juvenile offenses.

Four Royal Navy sailors have been charged with the gang rape of a young woman at an alcohol-fuelled party in a Canadian barracks. The men, identified as Joshua Finbow (23), Craig Stoner (24), Simon Radford (31), and Darren Smalley (35), appeared in court in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, and were granted bail with strict conditions. They must remain in Nova Scotia, surrender their passports, and live on the Stadacona naval base in Halifax until their trial. The alleged assault occurred on April 10 after the sailors returned from a hockey game. They were in Canada to play for the Royal Navy ice hockey team. The victim, in her early 20s, attended the party with a friend who was invited by local Canadian servicemen. The sailors face charges of sexual assault causing bodily harm and group sexual assault, punishable by up to 14 years in prison. They will continue to work for the Royal Navy and receive their current pay, but cannot resign without court permission.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Valerie Jackson, a mother from Las Vegas, was reported to the police for child abuse by a stranger who mistook her son RJ's rare skin disease, Netherton's syndrome, for signs of abuse. Netherton's syndrome is an incredibly rare congenital skin disease affecting only 70 people worldwide, causing the skin to appear red, scaly, and inflamed. Jackson regularly covers RJ's skin with creams to prevent dryness and alleviate pain. Despite her efforts, she and her son face ignorance, taunts, and bullying from the public, including adults. The family has been denied entry to places and has even had the police called on them due to the condition. There is no cure, but symptoms often improve over time. Jackson discovered a Facebook support group for the condition, which helped her understand and manage RJ's disease.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Campaigners against Protein World's "Are You Beach Body Ready?" adverts are celebrating as Transport for London (TFL) has decided to remove the controversial posters from the London Underground.

- The adverts have also faced backlash on social media, with thousands of tweets directed at the campaign, and a planned protest in Hyde Park on May 2nd.
- Protein World has actively defended their campaign on social media, engaging in heated exchanges with critics.
- The Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) received 216 complaints and is assessing them to determine if further action is needed.

rail firms are planning fare hikes of up to 87 per cent on certain routes.
This comes despite promises from main party leaders to freeze prices.
Prime Minister David Cameron has requested First Great Western (FGW) to urgently review its decision to almost double some fares on the London to Cotswolds route, which passes through his constituency.
Passengers from Charlbury, the nearest station to Cameron's constituency home, will see an off-peak return to London increase from £33.30 to £62.40 from May 17.
Train companies have three windows annually to increase 'unregulated' fares, which make up half of their revenue.
FGW defends the change as necessary to align prices on the North Cotswolds route with their other services.
Other significant price hikes are planned by London Midlands and Virgin Trains on various routes.
Virgin claims their overall fare increase is below the industry average and that most price hikes affect their own cheaper fares.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Former soldier John Young, 66, was blinded in one eye after thugs threw a brick at him through his front door.
- The attack occurred when he confronted them about throwing stones at his property in Oldham.
- Young and his wife Elaine, 54, were sitting in their living room when the incident happened.
- He underwent emergency surgery but doctors couldn't save his left eye.
- The couple, who got married just three weeks earlier, are now moving away as they feel unsafe in the neighborhood.
- Police are investigating, believing it may be a case of yobs "messing around" with no apparent motive.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Derbyshire wicketkeeper Tom Poynton, 25, has signed a new one-year contract extension with the county, keeping him at the club until the end of the 2016 season.
- Poynton missed the entire 2014 campaign due to leg injuries sustained in a road accident that resulted in the death of his father, Keith, in April 2014.
- He underwent an ankle operation and made his playing comeback during Derbyshire's pre-season tour of Abu Dhabi.
- Graeme Welch, Derbyshire's elite performance director, praised Poynton's exceptional character and tireless effort in training and off-the-field preparations for his return.
- Welch expressed hope that the new contract would give Poynton confidence to express himself on the field and continue his good form shown since his return.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Five-year-old Harley Renshaw was diagnosed with neuroblastoma, a rare and aggressive childhood cancer, in his kidney, neck, lungs, and bones.
- During radiotherapy treatment, Harley wore a superhero costume and decorated his protective mask to look like a Ninja Turtle, helping him feel brave.
- Harley's story gained worldwide attention, and he received a box of Ninja Turtle presents from the children's TV channel Nickelodeon for Christmas.
- After a year of treatment, including chemotherapy, an operation, a stem cell transplant, and radiotherapy, Harley has been given the all-clear by doctors and is now cancer-free.
- He will continue to have regular check-ups and is expected to return to school full-time soon.
- Harley's bravery earned him a Little Star Award from Cancer Research UK, and he has become the face of their kids and teens campaign.

Tim Sherwood believes Jack Grealish should focus on his Aston Villa career before making a decision on his international future.
Grealish, 19, is wanted by both the Republic of Ireland and England.
Sherwood wants Grealish to continue impressing for Villa before deciding his international allegiance.
Grealish's father, Kevin, agrees that his son should prioritize club football.

Here's a concise summary of the passage:

- **Topic**: Landing fees for private jets at international airports.
- **Key Points**:
  - Private jet travel is growing, with 2.5 million flights in the US (2013) and 705,000 in Europe.
  - Landing fees vary greatly, revealing popular hubs for the rich, e.g., Salzburg (Austria) and Darwin (Australia).
  - The three most expensive airports for landing fees are in Japan: Haneda (Tokyo), Narita (Tokyo), and Kansai (Osaka).
  - Haneda Airport is the most expensive, charging £4,559 ($6,850) per landing for a 767-400 jet.
  - Other top 10 expensive airports include Toronto (Canada), Darwin (Australia), Bristol (UK), and Dublin (Ireland).
  - Popular routes include Los Angeles to Las Vegas and Milan to Rome.
  - Busy periods for private jets include major sporting events like the Super Bowl and Monaco Grand Prix.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Katie Gallegos from Clackamas County, Oregon, took her dogs, Cooper and Daisy, to a McDonald's drive-thru for ice cream.
- While Daisy took a few licks, Cooper quickly gobbled up the rest of the ice cream cone in one bite.
- Gallegos noted that Cooper always eats quickly, and she ensures Daisy gets her share first.
- A video of Cooper's ice cream outing has been viewed over 7 million times.
- Some viewers criticized feeding dogs ice cream, but Gallegos defended it, stating Cooper is healthy and athletic.
- The dogs also enjoy a "pup-uccino" from Starbucks, which is essentially whipped cream in a cup.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Gary Locke, 41, has been appointed as the permanent manager of Kilmarnock on a three-year contract.
- He initially joined as assistant manager to Allan Johnston in the summer of 2016.
- Locke took over as interim manager when Johnston resigned in February and has since lost only one game in seven.
- The former Hearts boss will hold a press conference on Friday morning.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

A Florida mother, Jessica Kemp, has accused Seminole County Elementary School of threatening to suspend her 5-year-old autistic son, Logan, due to essential oils she applies to his head and neck to help him stay calm and focused. The school claimed the oils, manufactured by doTERRA, were a distraction and had a strong smell. Kemp argued that her son had been using the oils all year without issue until a teacher's aide complained. She received a letter from the school board stating the oils caused a problem for staff and students. Despite the threat, Kemp plans to continue using the oils, which have a positive impact on her son, and the school district later stated they would not suspend Logan, considering it a health issue. The family uses oils with scents like lavender, chamomile, and sandalwood.

A beach-side apartment complex in the Hamptons was destroyed by a fire on Wednesday afternoon.
The fire spread through 90 condos and melted paint off nearby buildings.
Twelve fire crews were deployed but could not control the flames or enter the building.
The cause of the fire is under investigation, with one theory suggesting it started near a car parked by the complex.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- She was accompanied by a groom and wore a silk scarf instead of a riding helmet.
- The Queen has a lifelong love of horses and has been riding since she was four years old.
- She has a collection of horses and ponies, including fell ponies, which she breeds at Hampton Court.
- Despite encouragement to wear a riding helmet, the Queen refuses due to her concern about her hair.
- In recent years, she has ridden less due to a knee injury.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- An argument over noise levels between two Brisbane neighbours resulted in the death of 55-year-old Leon Yeaman.
- Yeaman was allegedly killed by a single punch to the head from 28-year-old Phillip Pama during a confrontation in front of their homes.
- Pama, a shift worker and father of three, was sleeping when Yeaman was making noise in his yard.
- Pama's lawyer stated that Yeaman was known for disruptive behaviour, including playing loud music and yelling.
- During the bail application, Pama's lawyer revealed that his client threw a blind punch while being pushed, unintentionally striking Yeaman.
- Paramedics were unable to revive Yeaman, who was pronounced dead at the scene.
- Neighbours described Yeaman as kind and generous, while a friend mentioned his schizophrenia and love for loud music.
- Pama was granted conditional bail and is charged with manslaughter. He has no prior history of violence and is grief-stricken.
- The case will return to court on May 18.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Yulia Simonova, a 52-year-old music teacher, wanted to hire a hitman to torture and murder her 15-year-old former pupil, Damian Vanya, after he ended their relationship.
- She offered 100,000 rubles (GBP 1,400) to have him slowly bleed to death.
- Police set up a sting operation with an undercover officer posing as a hitman. Simonova was filmed detailing her plan and arrested after handing over expense money.
- Simonova faces up to 15 years in prison for attempted murder.
- Vanya ended the relationship to be with a classmate and expressed relief at Simonova's arrest, hoping she receives a severe punishment.

- Mourinho was fined £25,000 earlier this season for comments about a "campaign" against Chelsea.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Bob Barker, who hosted "The Price is Right" for 35 years, returned to the show for the first time in eight years on April 1, 2015. At age 91, Barker looked spry and handled the first price-guessing game, "Lucky Seven," before handing over hosting duties to Drew Carey, the current host. Despite his long absence, Barker appeared to be in his element and didn't miss a beat.

Here's a concise summary of the passage:

Off-duty Secret Service agent Arthur Baldwin was arrested in Washington D.C. for allegedly attempting to break into a house at midnight. Assigned to the Foreign Missions Branch, Baldwin's arrest follows recent misconduct allegations against other Secret Service officials, including a high-ranking supervisor. These incidents are under investigation by the Homeland Security Department's Inspector General.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

He exited his car and crept within 10 feet of the lion, lying on the ground to take a few frames with only his camera. The camera's shutter sound alerted the lion, forcing Saeed to retreat quickly. He described the lion treating him like prey and shared his motivation to showcase the lion's character. Saeed acknowledged the danger of the encounter and expressed doubt about repeating it.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- She had no identification but had a tattoo on her right leg: the name "Monique" etched on a ribbon within a heart, topped with a rose.
- Paramedics were unable to revive her, and she was pronounced dead.
- The medical examiner's report on the cause of death is pending.
- Anyone with information about the woman is asked to contact NYPD Crime Stoppers.

**Summary:**

- A New Zealand couple, Hannah and Alex, built a solar-powered home on the back of a 1986 Hino flatbed truck after returning from the UK.
- The two-bedroom wood and steel home cost approximately $25,000 and took a year and a half to construct.
- The home is nearly self-sufficient, with solar panels providing most of the electricity, a gas-powered stove and hot water, and water from a nearby spring.

- They plan to build another similar home in the future.

Here's a concise summary of the passage:

- Researchers claim that children who share iPads in class perform better in early literacy tests compared to those who don't.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

A two-legged piglet in China has become an internet sensation after learning to walk on its front trotters. Born with its back legs missing, the piglet demonstrates remarkable balance in a heartwarming video. It belongs to farmer Ms. Duan from Qionglai City, Sichuan Province, and has attracted visitors from nearby villages. The piglet, nicknamed "Super Pig," is able to mix with its fully-legged siblings and forage for food while maintaining its unique stance. This isn't the first time a two-legged animal in China has gained fame, as a rabbit at Liuzhou Zoo also became a star attraction for walking on its front paws.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

A husband, Milton Vieira Severiano, brutally murdered his dancer wife, Cicera Alves de Sena, in their Rio de Janeiro apartment. CCTV footage shows him dragging her body into the garden, smashing her head into concrete paving 11 times, punching her face, and then shooting her in the face five times at point-blank range. Severiano confessed to the crime, motivated by jealousy over men looking at his wife. The incident occurred just four days after their marriage. Severiano was arrested after stealing a neighbor's car and faces a potential life sentence in jail.

Here's a concise summary of the passage:

- Journalist and author Sarah Wilson, 41, revealed her battle with mental illness in a candid interview.
- Anxiety and other factors led her to believe her life was no longer worth living, and she couldn't see a way out.
- Wilson believes depression and anxiety are intrinsically linked and need to be acknowledged to tackle rising rates among Australian women.
- She has accepted her anxious persona and aims to raise awareness about mental health struggles.
- One in three Australian women will experience anxiety in their lifetime, and it is becoming the 'new depression'.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Elena Curtin, a 23-year-old pregnant woman from Portland, Oregon, was charged with second-degree assault for attacking her boyfriend's ex-girlfriend with a crowbar in November 2014.
- Prosecutors dropped the charge as Curtin was "completely justified in her outrage" due to Oregon's law allowing physical force against intruders who refuse to leave.
- Curtin found the ex-girlfriend using heroin in her bathroom and asked her to leave, but she refused.
- Curtin's defense attorney described the ex as "jealous and bitter" and claimed she had been harassing and threatening Curtin.
- The boyfriend, who struggled with heroin addiction, has reconciled with his ex and is not involved with Curtin's child.
- Curtin gave birth in January and is now living with her parents.
